properties.areaDesc: Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range/East Lake County Above 11000 Ft; South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Flat Tops; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Avalanche Watch issued February 6 at 5:55AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE
COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER.

Avalanche Watch is in effect for most areas of the Northern and
Central Mountains.


* TIMING...Dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop
on Thursday night and into Friday.

* AFFECTED AREA...Park Range...the Flat Top Mountains...Medicine Bow
Mountains...Never Summer Mountains...the Front Range...Williams
Fork Mountains...Ten Mile Range...Gore Range...Vail...Elk
Mountains...Ruby Range...west Elk Mountains...Mosquito
Range....Sawatch Range.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...The avalanche danger rating is expected to
reach HIGH (Level 4) on Thursday night and will continue into
Friday.

* REASON...Heavy snowfall and strong winds will increase the
avalanche danger. Large avalanches will become very easy to
trigger. During periods of heavy snowfall avalanches will release
naturally.
properties.instruction:
terrain is not recommended on Thursday night and Friday as heavy
snow accumulates. Plan ahead for rapidly increasing avalanche
danger.

Consult www.colorado.gov/avalanche for detailed information.

Lazar
